news_header: David Boutflour, a former hospitality manager, is pursuing a Space Systems Degree Apprenticeship at Portsmouth University after a lifelong interest in space.
news_original_title: How to shift from lorry driver to space engineer
news_text: David Boutflour, 31, transitioned from a nine-year career in hospitality to pursue a Space Systems Degree Apprenticeship at Portsmouth University, inspired by his childhood interest in aviation and space. He switched to lorry driving to fund his education, surprising friends with his career change. The four-and-a-half-year program combines on-the-job learning with academic study in engineering. Fellow apprentices include Alice Overend, who has experience in satellite assembly, and George Smith, who recently completed A levels. The course emphasizes practical skills and problem-solving, appealing to those from diverse backgrounds. BAE Systems' Elizabeth Seward highlights the need for varied expertise in the space sector. The growing UK space industry, spurred by successful ventures like SpaceX, is creating new opportunities.
